items.title: Aussie dollar climbs as RBA raises rates and leaves door open to more hikes — as it happened
items.summary: The Reserve Bank has hiked the cash rate 0.25 percentage points to 3.85 per cent, in its first rate rise in more than two years. The Aussie dollar rose back above 70 US cents after the decision.

items.title: Seaspray beach residents push back on wind farm turbines 10km from shore
items.summary: A tiny coastal community in Victoria's east is battling an international wind energy giant that wants to build 60 to 70 turbines in the ocean 10 kilometres from shore.

items.title: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says Minions music barred due to copyright issue
items.summary: Spanish figure skater Tomas-Llorenc Guarino Sabate says he will not be allowed to use the music from the Minions film franchise that he has skated to throughout the season at the Milano Cortina Games due to a copyright clearance issue.

items.title: Sita Walker's debut novel, In a Common Hour, takes place across a single hour at a state high school
items.summary: Sita Walker, an English teacher from Brisbane, explains how she tackled her first work of fiction, set in a single hour at a state high school.

items.title: High Court to consider if Victoria's strict cap on individual political donations is discriminatory
items.summary: Two independent Victorian political candidates will ask the High Court to overturn a state law capping political donations to just under $5,000 but allowing an exception for the major parties.

items.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
items.summary: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

items.title: Josh Hazlewood to miss start of T20 World Cup, Mitch Marsh shrugs off Pakistan loss
items.summary: Speedster Josh Hazlewood will miss the early stages of the T20 World Cup as captain Mitch Marsh shrugs off Australia's lamentable capitulations in their warm-up series in Pakistan.

items.title: Victorian GPs to be trained to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children
items.summary: General practitioners in Victoria will soon be able to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children in a move the state government says will cut lengthy wait times and save thousands of dollars.

items.title: Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance to help rough sleepers through extreme weather
items.summary: Tim knows firsthand the struggles of being homeless and navigating the weather, but it's experiences like his which will be the focus of a newly formed Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance.

items.title: Citizen scientists look for hope as the algal bloom persists
items.summary: On Kangaroo Island – where the bloom has washed death ashore for almost a year – a group of citizen scientists are focusing their efforts on "what’s still out there".

items.title: Where do you spend your money? Tell us
items.summary: We are keen to understand how the cost of living is being felt across Australia. What are your biggest expenses? Are you making cutbacks? Do you afford yourself luxuries?

items.title: Panic selling hits gold as analysts warn of potential 'regime change' in financial markets
items.summary: The precious metals market collapses following the appointment of new US Federal Reserve chair Kevin Warsh, and some analysts say it signals a significant shift in the world's financial markets.

items.title: Should I take a fish oil supplement for my heart, joints or mood?
items.summary: Fish oil is one of the most popular dietary supplements. It's often promoted for protecting the heart, boosting mood, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall health.

items.title: If the Reserve Bank starts the year with a rate hike, you can't say it didn't warn us
items.summary: Could RBA economists conceivably see inflation returning to target without a rate hike? We'll know this afternoon, and while it's not the dominant view, it's not a fringe one, either.

items.title: One Nation condemned for 'spot the Westerner' video
items.summary: A One Nation party official has filmed strangers on Melbourne's streets claiming the city "doesn't look like a Western nation at all".

items.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
items.summary: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

items.title: Brisbane baby coffee assault tests Australia-China relations
items.summary: Sixteen months after a stranger poured scalding coffee over a baby in a Brisbane park, China's decision to send a working group to Australia marks the first tangible shift in a complicated case.

items.title: Donald Trump announces trade deal between US and India with tariffs slashed
items.summary: The US president says his social media platform that a deal had been struck, which includes a reduction of tariffs on Indian products in exchange for New Delhi no longer buying oil from Russia.

items.title: Sarah Ferguson called Epstein a 'legend', told him to 'just marry me', new emails show
items.summary: The former Duchess of York's friendship with the late sex offender is back in the spotlight after the latest release of documents about the Epstein case.

items.title: Keir Starmer orders investigation into Peter Mandelson's ties to Jeffrey Epstein
items.summary: Documents released reportedly show Peter Mandelson sent Jeffrey Epstein briefing notes meant for then-British prime minister Gordon Brown.

items.title: Trump administration to unveil rare-earths mineral stockpile to counter China
items.summary: A $US12 billion ($17.2 billion) investment from the US Export-Import Bank is attracting attention from major American car companies, and comes as Washington seeks to break China's dominance of resources key for military and computing applications.

items.title: Dalai Lama's Grammy win slammed as 'anti-China' by Chinese government
items.summary: The 90-year-old, who lives in exile from his Tibetan homeland, says he accepts the award with "gratitude and humility" but it has sparked a furious response from China.

items.title: Sarah Court to be first female head of ASIC, Treasurer Jim Chalmers announces
items.summary: This position will give Ms Court significant influence over Australian corporate culture.

items.title: WA man to serve at least 21 years in jail for 'brutal' murder of father
items.summary: A man who committed a "horrific" attack on his father in regional WA, recording some of it and posting it online, will have to serve at least 21 years for murder.

items.title: Ley and Littleproud hold 'civil' talks but yet to agree terms for Coalition reunion
items.summary: The federal Liberal and National leaders held eleventh-hour crisis talks after David Littleproud survived an unlikely challenge from as disgruntled backbencher.

items.title: Woman who fatally hit and drove away from Alexx Wright, 19, sentenced to three years' jail
items.summary: A 45-year-old woman is sentenced after fatally striking a 19-year-old with her car in WA's Midwest and failing to stop and offer assistance.

items.title: Mosman Park suspected double murder-suicide prompts calls for greater support for families with high-needs children
items.summary: A suspected murder-suicide in Perth has put the spotlight on families with high needs children, with speculation that the Clune family were not getting the support they needed in the lead up to their deaths.

items.title: Epstein files suggest Mandelson kept paedophile informed on Rudd's mining super profits tax
items.summary: Newly released documents show British Labour peer Peter Mandelson kept sex trafficking paedophile Jeffrey Epstein informed about the campaign against Kevin Rudd's proposed mining tax.

items.title: Grammys 2026: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish slam ICE at music's biggest awards
items.summary: The 2026 Grammys blended protest, celebration and cultural change as artists confronted powers that be, embraced diversity and reshaped the night's biggest awards.

items.title: 'Lucky' fishermen rescued after boat fire near Binalong Bay, Tasmania
items.summary: Two boaties stranded at sea for eight hours after their tinnie caught fire chose a survival plan police described as "highly unrecommended" — to set it on fire again.

items.title: Australian woman killed in ski lift accident at popular snow resort in Japan
items.summary: Police in Japan confirmed to ABC News the woman’s name is Brooke Day, from Queensland's Sunshine Coast, who was taking a lift at the Tsugaike Mountain Resort when she became caught and suffered critical injuries.

items.title: Found a PCOS 'cure' on social media? It might not be for you
items.summary: Advice on how to "manage", "treat" and "heal" PCOS is easy to come by online, but experts say a more personalised approach is usually what's needed.

items.title: Corporate Travel Management founder Jamie Pherous resigns amid overcharging scandal
items.summary: Corporate Travel Management boss Jamie Pherous has exited from all his executive and board roles as he moves to a "strategic advisory role."

items.title: Sydney police officer allegedly armed himself with bat and assaulted pair over 'knock and run' game
items.summary: A senior police officer is accused of arming himself with a bat and assaulting a pair of young men who knocked on his front door and hid.

items.title: Norwegian rape trial rocks the royal family and grips the public
items.summary: This week, Marius Borg Høiby, the stepson of Norway's future king, will face trial on a string of rape, drug and abuse charges, and it has the whole country talking.

items.title: Grammy winners 2026: Bad Bunny takes home Album of The Year, Olivia Dean Best New Artist
items.summary: The 68th Grammy Awards main ceremony has happened in Lose Angeles. See who won what here.

items.title: Australian monobob star Bree Walker welcomes pressure at 2026 Winter Olympic Games
items.summary: The g-force felt hurtling down the bobsleigh track is the only pressure Bree Walker is feeling despite the Australian speed demon entering the Winter Olympics as one of the gold-medal favourites.

items.title: Liam Conejo Ramos returns to Minnesota after being detained by ICE on way home from preschool
items.summary: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos, whose detention by federal agents as he returned from preschool sparked outrage across the United States, has been released from immigration detention, according to a US congressman.

items.title: From Sabalenka to Djokovic and 'animals in the zoo', here are the best quotes from the Australian Open 2026
items.summary: From tennis stars pushing for more privacy, to Djokovic saying he feels like an old man and a Kyrgios F-bomb, there have been some funny and weird quotes at this year's Australian Open.

items.title: Today in History, February 2: Balto and the dogs of 1925's Great Serum Run
items.summary: Children of an icebound Alaskan town were dying. The journey to save them would be treacherous, freezing, and in these dogs' paws.

items.title: 2026 Grammy Awards red carpet: Sabrina Carpenter, Olivia Dean arrive in style for the ceremony
items.summary: The best and most memorable red carpet looks at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards.

items.title: Will the RBA increase interest rates today?
items.summary: The market thinks the RBA is likely to lift interest rates on Tuesday, but the market has been wrong before.

items.title: Australian Winter Olympics team staff test positive for COVID-19 ahead of 2026 Milano Cortina Games
items.summary: Australia's Winter Olympics preparations will continue with minimal fuss in northern Italy despite two members of staff testing positive for COVID-19.

items.title: Arsenal wins FIFA Women's Champions Cup as Matilda Caitlin Foord scores winning goal
items.summary: Arsenal have become the first women's world soccer champions, with Matildas star Caitlin Foord clinching the title for the Gunners in extra time.

items.title: Nightcliff Tigers premiership player sues AFL over 'catastrophic' concussion
items.summary: Nightcliff Tigers dual-premiership player Trent Melville is suing the AFL in the NT Supreme Court after suffering "catastrophic injuries" in a head clash with another player in 2022.

items.title: Mary Fowler returns to the pitch as Manchester City hammer Chelsea in Women's Super League
items.summary: Matildas star Mary Fowler returns to football after a nine-and-a-half-month injury lay-off, as Manchester City thumps Chelsea in the Women's Super League.

items.title: Australia suffers heaviest T20 defeat, Pakistan to boycott World Cup match against India
items.summary: Australia slumps to a 3-0 T20 series defeat in Pakistan, leading into this month's World Cup.

items.title: 'Cynical and targeted' Russian strike on Ukrainian bus kills 12
items.summary: A series of attacks across Ukraine comes ahead of US-brokered trilateral talks between Ukraine and Russia set for the coming week.

items.title: Alcaraz and Djokovic thrill Rafa and a 'boring' heckle delights Rod Laver Arena — quick hits from the Australian Open men's final
items.summary: Rafael Nadal gives his seal of approval and Novak Djokovic collects the one trophy missing from his cabinet as his Melbourne Park fortunes flip. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

items.title: Novak Djokovic praises Carlos Alcaraz after Spaniard wins first Australian Open title
items.summary: Despite the hollow feeling of defeat, 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic heaps praise on Carlos Alcaraz following the Spaniard's history-making Australian Open victory.

items.title: Inside Donald Trump's ICE detention centre boom — and the families caught in the crackdown
items.summary: The Trump administration's rapid expansion of ICE detention centres has led to inhumane conditions, record deaths and allegations of abuse, civil rights watchdogs warn.

items.title: Unnecessary interest rate cuts derailed the national housing affordability project
items.summary: The great unspoken truth about central banking and monetary policy is that while it's aimed at consumer prices, its most direct impact is on house prices, which are arguably the most important prices of all.

items.title: The economy should be the focus but Coalition incompetence is a gift to Labor
items.summary: The trip to the tennis is a sign of the PM's own sense of confidence. It's a move that is only made by a man who clearly has his mojo back.

items.title: Preparations underway at Gaza's Rafah crossing a day before Israel says travel will resume
items.summary: Although Gaza has four other border crossings, they are shared with Israel, and many Palestinians see Rafah as their gateway to the world.

items.title: Novak Djokovic drops retirement hint, suggests 2026 could be his final Australian Open
items.summary: Novak Djokovic did not go into detail on what he meant, nor did he confirm a plan to retire this year, but he chose his words carefully on centre court.

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz has his never-before moment by beating Novak Djokovic in his own house
items.summary: Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Novak Djokovic in a pulsating Australian Open final, becoming the youngest man with a career Grand Slam in the process.

items.title: Clive Palmer rejects Steve Bannon influence claim in latest Epstein files
items.summary: Clive Palmer denies newly surfaced claims that his 2019 federal election campaign was influenced by a senior advisor to US President Donald Trump.

items.title: The Grammys are on Monday morning — here's how to watch and who to look out for
items.summary: From Kendrick Lamar to Lady Gaga, here are all the nominees and performers to look out for at the Grammys this year.

items.title: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq dismisses Australia's Cameron Green's gesture about his action in second T20I
items.summary: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq responds after Cameron Green appeared to mimic his action in Australia's comprehensive T20 loss in Lahore.

items.title: Alex Volkanovski retains featherweight championship with decision victory over Diego Lopes at UFC 325
items.summary: Alex Volkanovski's win over Diego Lopes at UFC 325 was enough to retain the world featherweight title and give Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter and his fans exactly what they were looking for.

items.title: Matildas legend Sarah Walsh says South Korea boycott would be 'devastating' for Asian Cup
items.summary: Asian Cup organisers say they are hopeful the South Korean women's team will partake in next month's tournament despite threats of a boycott due to "harsh and unreasonable conditions" under the nation's federation.

items.title: 'Job finished' for Carlos Alcaraz as he wins first Australian Open
items.summary: Carlos Alcaraz is the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam, beating 24-time major winner Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final.

items.title: Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina eyeing more success after victory over Aryna Sabalenka
items.summary: Newly-crowned Australian Open champion Elena Rybakina isn't content with a second grand slam title following a rampant run through the Melbourne Park draw.

items.title: Inside the brand strategy behind the Beckham family drama — and who controls the narrative now
items.summary: In a modern crisis, experts say control doesn't always come from speaking louder — but from knowing when, where and how briefly to speak at all.
